additionalDescription: Individuals recorded separately, and caught from the wid. Birds older than 1 year. Some of the birds were injected testoterone "before audio recordings to increase singing behavior". The birds don't sing in every clip
description:
A dataset of song collected from 14 European starlings individually recorded
in acoustically isolated chambers. Each folder contains vocalizations for one
bird.

These data were used for the publication, "_Parallels in the sequential
organization of birdsong and human speech_ ". Nature Communications (2019). If
you use this dataset, please cite this publication and this repository.

Work supported by NSF Graduate Research Fellowship 2017216247 to TS and an NIH
R56DC016408 to TQG.
name: European starling
recordingPeriod: 2008, 2017, and 2018, at various points during the year
